Guimaras is situated east of Panay Island and was once part of the province of Iloilo before it became independent. It is known much for its sweet mangoes which is one of the main incomes of most families.

value: , it is the provincial capital of Guimaras.

to Jordan. Take note that there are two ports in Iloilo that have boats going to Guimaras. One goes to Buenavista and the other one is in Jordan. The port going to Jordan is located in Ortiz (near SM Delgado and Robinson's Place) and can be reached by cab. As of August 2013, pumpboat fares going to Jordan cost 14 pesos.

Upon arriving in Jordan port, proceed to the Tourism Center just a few meters from the drop-off point. From there, you can ask for assistance getting around. There are also several mini-van and tricycle drivers who offer tour rides.

There are several driver-guides which can be contacted prior to arriving in Guimaras:

There is a souvenir shop located beside the Guimaras Provincial Capitol where you can buy local delicacies.

The best time to buy mangoes is during summer time (mid-April).

Guimaras' pride are is its mangoes which are known to be one of the sweetest mangoes. Mangoes are grown at a massive production that they are made into dried mangoes, jam and surprisingly... mango ketchup.

content= As an eco tourism resort, Nagarao's accommodations are suited to its environment. Individual cottages with tiled toilets and showers face the beach which is lined by flowering plants and trees. In Nagarao, you can eat to your heart's content as food is served fresh with ingredients coming from the sea and local farms.
